alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Coastal Duval; Coastal Nassau; Coastal St. Johns; Eastern Clay; Inland Nassau; Inland St. Johns; South Central Duval; Trout River; Western Clay; Western Duval (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 8:53AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Heavy showers with strong winds will impact portions of east central Nassau, northeastern Bradford, northwestern St. Johns, southeastern Baker, northern Clay, Duval and southeastern Camden Counties through 915 AM EST... At 852 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking heavy showers along a line extending from 8 miles east of Kings Bay Base to near Maxville. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Fernandina Beach, Orange Park, Jacksonville International Arpt, Unf, Mandarin, Fruit Cove, Arlington, Ponte Vedra Beach and Middleburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EST for northeastern Florida.
